result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on December 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:32 PM DA calls cases: 21CM66, 22CM10, 22CM31, 22CM32 and states appearances. Defendant Jerry W. Hughes II in court.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Jerry W. Hughes II.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Restemayer gives status updates in each matter called. DA Kelz gives 12/07/2022 at 3:00 PM for a Motion Hearing date on all matters called.
Status hearing on September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant Jerry W. Hughes II in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Bond to Continue. Notice of right to attorney given to DE. If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.

01:15 PM ADA calls cases: 22CM31, 22CM32 and states appearances. Defendant Jerry W. Hughes appeared, in custody by video means. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant gives explaination of non appearance on 05/17/2022. ADA Fuhr motions to have the warrant quashed. So ordered. ADA Fuhr requests a Signature bond of $1,000 in each matter. So ordered. Adjourned Initial appearance set for 5/31/22 at 10:00 AM

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): M.A.N unless a written consent is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office OR the Price County Sheriff's Office outside of normal business hours. 
 *No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances.

10:07 AM calls cases: 22CM31, 22CM32 and states appearances. Defendant does not appear. Karl J Kelz appeared for The State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the history of notices sent, no notic have been sent back undeliverable. DA Kelz motions for a bench warrant covering both cases in the amount of $2,000 for non appearance. So Ordered plus warrant fee.
Demand for discovery and Notice of intent to use DNA
